items.question: Does James Franco make an appearance as New Goblin?
items.answer: James Franco's Harry Osborn is referenced in the film but does not appear.

items.question: Will Michael Keaton return as Vulture?
items.answer: No, he will not for this film, but he does appear in the Morbius film and it is implied he is assembling a team to fight Spider-Man/Peter Parker, much like The Sinister Six.

items.question: How are they doing the filming during COVID pandemic?
items.answer: Just like they did. Safely and within protocol.

items.question: It originally had the runtime at 2 hours and 39 minutes, then few days before the film was released, it was cut for 9 minutes, then another 2 minutes (now it's 2 hours and 28 minutes). Why it was cut?
items.answer: For pacing purposes, possibly. There were already too many characters for the story, so the scenes were left out of the movie. They will be available separately on the Blu-ray featurettes section.

items.question: Can we expect a director's cut?
items.answer: Marvel Studios recently revealed in the summer of 2022 (about three months since the theatrical release of No Way Home ended) that there will be an extended cut of the film that will incorporate more footage. It will premiere in theaters in September 2022 and has been confirmed by multiple sources. Also, it has officially been declared 'The More Fun Stuff Cut', a slight reference to Marvel's rival company, DC Comics, and the unofficial title of the definitive four-hour cut of Justice League: The Snyder Cut, as it features only footage shot by Zack Snyder, no Joss Whedon.

items.question: Will Dr. Connors/Lizard or Sandman ever get a spin off film or the Vulture? In my opinion those 3 villains need a spin off.
Is May Peter's marriage related aunt?
items.answer: May was the wife of late Ben Parker, brother of Peter's dad: Richard Parker..

items.question: Is there actually going to be a sequel with just Andrew Garfield returning since Tom Holland is taking a break from acting? Will there be a The Amazing spiderman 3?
items.answer: You never know. No one is ever really gone.

items.question: Will Dylan Baker appear as Dr. Curtis Connors and will he become the Lizard in this Spider-Man entry?
items.answer: In the current cut, Dylan Baker does not appear, which is sad since his character was teased repeatedly of becoming the Lizard in the Sam Raimi Spider-Man films.

items.question: Does Bruce Campbell appear in this?
items.answer: Sadly, no, especially since he was supposed to wind up being Mysterio/Quentin Beck in the Sam Raimi trilogy. However, since he briefly appears in Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, it raises the possibility that he may finally become Mysterio.

items.question: Does Anne Hathaway appear in this as the Black Cat?
items.answer: No, she does not. Though, reportedly, you can see an appearance of the Black Cat during the scene where Doctor Strange is trying to keep the multiverse together.

items.question: Why don't all the duplicates of the Multiverse look identical here when in the Doctor Strange Multiverse story they do?
items.answer: "infinite number of universes with an infinite number of posibilities"That means (in example) there's an universe where Dr. Strange looks like Peter Parker and viceversa. The variants dont have to look EXACTLY like the other, the perfect example was shown in "Loki" (Loki, Sylvie, Classic Loki, Child, etc)

spoilerItems.question: Who will be the villains of 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'?
spoilerItems.answer: Willem Dafoe's Green Goblin, Alfred Molina's Doctor Octopus, Thomas Haden Church's Sandman, Rhys Ifans' Lizard and Jamie Foxx's Electro are the villains of "Spider-Man: No Way Home." The actors reprise their roles from "Spider-Man," "Spider-Man 2," "Spider-Man 3," "The Amazing Spider-Man," and "The Amazing Spider-Man 2," respectively.

spoilerItems.question: Will Willem Dafoe make an appearance in this new Spider-Man movie?
spoilerItems.answer: Willem Dafoe does reprise his role as Norman Osborn / Green Goblin in No Way Home.

spoilerItems.question: Will Jamie Foxx return as Electro from The Amazing Spider-Man 2?
spoilerItems.answer: Yes, Jamie Foxx does reprise his role as Max Dillon / Electro in No Way Home.

spoilerItems.question: Will Paul Giamatti return as Rhino?
spoilerItems.answer: Neither Rhino nor Paul Giamatti appear in the film. Though Rhino is referenced.

spoilerItems.question: Is Tom Hardy's version of Venom going to be in the film?
spoilerItems.answer: Yes, Eddie appears in the mid-credits scene sitting in a bar, interacting with a bartender and Venom. When the multiverse is restored, they get pulled back to their own universe, while unknowingly leaving a piece of the Symbiote behind, seemingly teasing another Symbiote to appear in either a Venom or a Spider-Man movie.

spoilerItems.question: Will Charlie Cox reprise the role of Daredevil in this movie?
spoilerItems.answer: Charlie Cox returns as Matt Murdock, who is the lawyer for the Parkers. He only appears briefly, where he explains Peter's possible criminal liabilities. When someone throws a rock through the window Matt quickly catches it amazing even Peter, though Matt passes it off as quick reflexes.

spoilerItems.question: Does Kirsten Dunst or Emma Stone return?
spoilerItems.answer: Both Mary Jane Watson and Gwen Stacy are referenced but neither appear.

spoilerItems.question: How is Peter able to move when his body is separated from his astral form?
spoilerItems.answer: There isn't any clear explanation for this within the movie itself but in the comics though, Peter's spider-sense is said to trigger an instinctive response from his body, allowing him to avoid danger without making any conscious decisions.

spoilerItems.question: Does this movie retcon SpiderMan 1-3 and The Amazing SpiderMan 1&2 or the returning characters from those films variants (as shown in the "Loki" TV series)?
spoilerItems.answer: No the stories of the existing movies will stay intact due to the way the mutiverse works.

spoilerItems.question: What did Andrew Garfield's Peter mean by "So you have magic here too". What magic influence did the TASM universe have?
spoilerItems.answer: He wasn't meaning "too" in the sense of "we have magic, and you do too," he was meaning more "in addition to the other stuff I just listed, you have magic too?" Keep in mind he was just rambling prior about string theory, multi-dimensional reality, and matter displacement all being real.

spoilerItems.question: Tobey Maguire's Peter addressed Doc Ock but why didn't he speak to Norman Osborn at all? And why didn't he react while hearing Dr. Connor's name?
spoilerItems.answer: Norman Osborn showed up at the end of the movie (after Tobey appeared) and they did have a brief scene after Osborn was "cured". Tobey was pulled in at least a decade after the events of Spider-Man 3. He could've just as well forgotten it (or the writers forgot about it).

spoilerItems.question: Why wasn't Topher Grace's Venom in this when he knew Spider-Man's identity?
spoilerItems.answer: They hinted that people would just keep coming if they didn't stop it. They didn't say that every single person who knew was already there. The whole point was to stop the rest (as well as the infinite number of Peter Parkers in the Multiverse and the girlfiends, Uncle Bens etc)It's an easy way for them to try to avoid confusion as well as keeping the things people didn't like about the older movies out of this one.

spoilerItems.question: Who was seen coming through the barrier but not identified?
spoilerItems.answer: The barrier can briefly see the spidey Villain scorpion and rhino and more

spoilerItems.question: What did Tobey's Peter mean by "I've thought about a cure for Osborn for some time now"? Peter had clearly aged and Osborn was already dead in his universe.
spoilerItems.answer: Being dead would not necessarily stop Peter from thinking up a cure for Norman's mental illness, especially if there's a chance a relation of his could surface with the same ilnnes.

spoilerItems.question: What's with the LEGO Palpatine?
spoilerItems.answer: He has it to remember his friendship with Ned. The minifigure came with Ned's LEGO Death Star, which Peter and Ned built together in Spider-Man: Homecoming, the first installment of the trilogy that concludes with No Way Home.

spoilerItems.question: Why wasn't Dr. Strange able to bring Aunt May back to life?
spoilerItems.answer: Thats not possible: Dr Strange doesnt know any resucitation spells and he doesnt have the time stone anymore. Also, during the time that happend, he was imprisioned in the mirror dimension.
